result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenneth W Martoglio was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

4.  Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Petition and Stipulation to Waive Appearance and Order Extending Probation for Unpaid Court Obligations - 1 year (08/17/2017)

1:13 p.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Agent Deb Duel present in court.  Court questions defendant.  Statement by defendant.  Court finds the defendant has not made a good faith effort and extends probation for 1 year.  Court informs the defendant that if not paid, the Court will fashion conditions to include jail time.  Court instructs the defendant regarding counsel and how to obtain counsel.

Court adjourned at 1:16 p.m.
Probation review hearing on July 11, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
11:41 A.M.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement, defendant will plea to count 1 as amended to misdemeanor Battery and count 2 will be dismissed and read-in.  DA concurs.  Atty Privat concurs.  Defendant concurs.  DA moves to amend count 1 to Misdemeanor Battery.  Court grants the amendment.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation. 

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty to count 1 as amended to misdemeanor battery.  Court orders count be dismissed and read-in.    Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Privat.  Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:  SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 12 months.

CONDITIONS:

AODA and any follow-up
Domestic Violence Assessment and any follow-up
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.
Court costs

Court adjourned at 11:52 a.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 08-17-2015 11:00 am

2:13 p.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Barb Privat present.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - need some time to get an offer from the District Attorney.  Court will set for Plea & Sentencing on August 17, 2015 at 11:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 2:13 p.m.

3:31 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - defendant will waive the preliminary hearing.  Defendant concurs.

Court instructs the defendant regarding his right to a preliminary examination.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary examination.  Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial.

State files an information with the court.  Attorney Privat and defendant acknowledge receipt of the information and waives any reading.  Atty Privat enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant.

Court will set for Status Hearing on June 1, 2015 at 2:00 p.m.

Deb from the PD's office called and requested this matter be adjourned for two weeks as the PD's office is requesting more information from the defendant.  Believes the defendant will be eligible but they need the information.  Adjourned to March 30, 2015 at 1:00 p.m.

2:47 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court via video from the Green Lake County Jail and with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $2,500.00 signature bond and conditions of:  No Violent contact with anyone in his residence.  Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives the time limits.  Court will set for Status Hearing on February 23, 2015 at 1:00 P.M.
